skill.summary: Create and update Linear issues via CLI (write operations)
skill.author: Bind

security_audit.summary: This is a CLI wrapper skill for Linear API integration. Uses official @linear/sdk package for issue creation and updates. Requires LINEAR_API_KEY environment variable for authentication. No source code files present in directory, only metadata. Low risk due to limited scope and legitimate purpose.

content.user_title: Create and update Linear issues from CLI
content.value_statement: Creating and updating Linear issues requires navigating the web interface. This skill provides command-line tools to create issues, set priorities, assign team members, and update issue status directly from your terminal.
actual_capabilities: Create new issues with title, description, team, assignee, priority, labels, and project
Update existing issues including title, description, status, assignee, priority, and labels
Resolve team, user, and label names automatically (case-insensitive)
Output results as JSON for scripting integration
Add labels without removing existing labels
Remove project or assignee from issues
limitations: Requires bun runtime to be installed
Only supports write operations (create and update), not read or delete
Team, user, and label names must exist in your Linear workspace

use_cases.title: Quick issue creation
use_cases.description: Create bugs and feature requests from terminal without switching to browser

use_cases.title: Status workflow updates
use_cases.description: Update issue status and assignees during daily standups or after completing tasks

use_cases.title: Automated issue tracking
use_cases.description: Script automated issue creation from CI/CD pipelines or monitoring alerts

prompt_templates.title: Create simple issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Linear issue with title 'Fix login timeout bug', team 'Engineering', priority 'high', and description 'Users cannot login after 5 minutes of inactivity'

prompt_templates.title: Create detailed issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Linear issue titled 'Add dark mode support', assigned to 'Sarah Chen', with labels 'Feature' and 'UI', priority 'medium', and project 'Main App'

prompt_templates.title: Update issue status
prompt_templates.prompt: Update issue ENG-456 to status 'In Progress' and assign it to 'Michael Torres'

prompt_templates.title: Bulk update labels
prompt_templates.prompt: Update issue PROJ-789 by adding labels 'Q1' and 'Security' without removing existing labels

output_examples.input: Create a Linear issue with title 'Update API documentation', team 'Engineering', and labels 'Documentation'

best_practices: Store your LINEAR_API_KEY securely in environment variables, not in scripts
Use the --json flag when integrating with other tools or automation scripts
Verify team and user names exist before creating issues to avoid errors
anti_patterns: Hardcoding API keys directly in command arguments or scripts
Creating issues without descriptions when details are important for context
Using the same issue for multiple unrelated changes or requests

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Check individual tool documentation for compatibility.

faq.question: What are the rate limits?
faq.answer: Rate limits are determined by your Linear subscription plan. The skill uses the official Linear SDK which respects these limits.

faq.question: Can I use this with other issue trackers?
faq.answer: No. This skill is specifically designed for Linear. Use separate skills for Jira, GitHub Issues, or other platforms.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill uses your LINEAR_API_KEY for authentication. Data is transmitted directly between your environment and Linear servers.

faq.question: Why am I getting 'team not found' errors?
faq.answer: Verify the team name matches exactly (case-insensitive) with your Linear workspace. Team names must exist and be accessible with your API key.

faq.question: How is this different from linear-issues-read?
faq.answer: This skill (linear-issues-write) creates and updates issues. The linear-issues-read skill lists and searches existing issues. Use both together for full workflow support.
